name: Reference human epigenomes from Roadmap Epigenomics Consortium
desc: The NIH Roadmap Epigenomics Mapping Consortium was launched with the goal of producing a public resource of human epigenomic data to catalyze basic biology and disease-oriented research. The Consortium leverages experimental pipelines built around next-generation sequencing technologies to map DNA methylation, histone modifications, chromatin accessibility and small RNA transcripts in stem cells and primary ex vivo tissues selected to represent the normal counterparts of tissues and organ systems frequently involved in human disease (quoted from Roadmap website).

hublist.name: Roadmap Data from GEO
hublist.desc: The NIH Roadmap Epigenomics Mapping Consortium was launched with the goal of producing a public resource of human epigenomic data to catalyze basic biology and disease-oriented research. The Consortium leverages experimental pipelines built around next-generation sequencing technologies to map DNA methylation, histone modifications, chromatin accessibility and small RNA transcripts in stem cells and primary ex vivo tissues selected to represent the normal counterparts of tissues and organ systems frequently involved in human disease (quoted from Roadmap website).

hublist.name: methylCRF tracks from Roadmap
hublist.desc: Single CpG methylation value prediction by methylCRF algorithm (PMID:23804401) using Roadmap data.

name: Roadmap Epigenomics Integrative Analysis Hub
desc: The NIH Roadmap Epigenomics Mapping Consortium was launched with the goal of producing a public resource of human epigenomic data to catalyze basic biology and disease-oriented research. The Consortium leverages experimental pipelines built around next-generation sequencing technologies to map DNA methylation, histone modifications, chromatin accessibility and small RNA transcripts in stem cells and primary ex vivo tissues selected to represent the normal counterparts of tissues and organ systems frequently involved in human disease (quoted from Roadmap website).

hublist.name: Observed DNase and ChIP-seq Pvalue and Normalized RPKM RNAseq signal tracks
hublist.desc: Observed data Pvalue tracks for DNase and ChIP-seq, and Normalized RPKM signal tracks for RNAseq

hublist.name: Observed DNase and ChIP-seq Fold-change and Normalized RPKM RNAseq signal tracks
hublist.desc: Observed data Fold-change tracks for DNase and ChIP-seq, and Normalized RPKM signal tracks for RNAseq

hublist.name: All Chromatin states tracks
hublist.desc: include 15 state core model from observed data, 18 state expanded model from observed data and 25 state model from imputed data

hublist.name: Imputed data signal tracks
hublist.desc: All data types (histone, DNase, RNA and methylation)

hublist.name: Unconsolidated epigenomes, Observed DNase and ChIP-seq Pvalue signal tracks
hublist.desc: For the unconsolidated epigenomes, observed data Pvalue tracks for DNase and ChIP-seq

hublist.name: Unconsolidated epigenomes, Observed DNase and ChIP-seq Fold-change signal tracks
hublist.desc: For the unconsolidated epigenomes,observed data Fold-change tracks for DNase and ChIP-seq

hublist.name: Complete Consolidated dataset
hublist.desc: This is the complete set of Roadmap Epigenomics Integrative Analysis Hub. Consolidated refer to the 127 reference epigenomes that uses additional steps of pooling and subsampling and these are the ones used in the paper. All data types were reprocessed for the consolidated epigenomes.Also please refer to web portal if get slow loading of this hub.

hublist.name: Roadmap Epigenomics Analysis Hub Unconsolidated set
hublist.desc: Unconsolidated data is basically all the ChIP-seq and DNase Release 9 data at the EDACC as it was except filtered for 36 bp read length mappability and processed to create peak calls and signal tracks.

name: Encyclopedia of DNA Elements
desc: The Encyclopedia of DNA Elements (ENCODE) Consortium is an international collaboration of research groups funded by the National Human Genome Research Institute (NHGRI). The goal of ENCODE is to build a comprehensive parts list of functional elements in the human genome, including elements that act at the protein and RNA levels, and regulatory elements that control cells and circumstances in which a gene is active (quoted from UCSC ENCODE website).

name: Encyclopedia of DNA Elements (update)
desc: The Encyclopedia of DNA Elements (ENCODE) Consortium is an international collaboration of research groups funded by the National Human Genome Research Institute (NHGRI). The goal of ENCODE is to build a comprehensive parts list of functional elements in the human genome, including elements that act at the protein and RNA levels, and regulatory elements that control cells and circumstances in which a gene is active

name: Long-range chromatin interaction experiments
desc: A collection of published long-range chromatin interaction data sets on human cell types.

name: HiC interaction from Juicebox
desc: HiC interaction data sets from Juicebox.

hublist.name: HiC interaction experiments
hublist.desc: A collection of published long-range chromatin interaction data sets on human cell types.

hublist.name: Endometrioid Cancer Methylome from Wang Lab
institution: Wang Lab at Washington University in St. Louis
hublist.desc: The methylMnM software is used to identify DMRs by integrating MeDIP-Seq and MRE-Seq assay results.

hublist.name: Glioblastoma Methylome from Wang Lab
institution: Wang Lab at Washington University in St. Louis
hublist.desc: The methylMnM software is used to identify DMRs by integrating MeDIP-Seq and MRE-Seq assay results.

hublist.name: Motif Scan by Fimo
hublist.desc: The tracks (downloaded from the link above) display statistically significant matches between the human genome and motifs from the JASPAR CORE 2009 and TRANSFAC 10.2 motif databases. The quality of each match is summarized as a q-value, defined as the minimal false discovery rate threshold at which the match would be deemed significant. Only matches with a q-value â‰¤ 0.1 are shown.
